Asian Trails’ Digital Trails are now available in the Malaysian capital Kuala Lumpur. This is the third destination to embrace the digital travel trend, following the launch of our Digital Trails products in Bangkok and Hanoi over a year ago. The 𝘒𝘶𝘢𝘭𝘢 𝘓𝘶𝘮𝘱𝘶𝘳 𝘊𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘞𝘢𝘭𝘬𝘴 pass showcases different aspects of the city, from art and cuisine to traditional lifestyles and modern architecture. Learn more at https://buff.ly/4cn1flf Or begin your Digital Trails journey at https://buff.ly/4c66jtS #AsianTrails #DigitalTrails #KualaLumpur

Singapore will come alive this weekend with music, parades, fireworks and festivities to celebrate the country’s National Day. Buildings will be adorned with red and white flags as colourful performances and spectacular military displays demonstrate the nation’s strength and diversity. This year’s parade will feature 2,100 participants and 35 marching contingents, each representing a different aspect of life in the city-state. Those visiting the island state this weekend can join in the celebrations at the Padang, the former National Stadium or The Float @ Marina Bay. Contact Asian Trails Singapore for more details: https://buff.ly/3SpZfk2 #AsianTrails #Singapore #NationalDay #Festival

Asian Trails’ team recently took part in a community clean up event in the Ma Da Forest area in Southern Vietnam, about two hours from Ho Chi Minh City. In total, the group collected 244 kg of waste and delivered 51 gifts, several items of clothing and sports equipment to support children in the local area. The event was organised in collaboration with the Laiday Refill Station team, an organisation that promotes sustainable living in Vietnam. Continue reading: https://buff.ly/4cdcDQw For more information about our responsible travel programmes, visit: https://buff.ly/4eV15DN #AsianTrails #Vietnam #CSR #responsibletravel #sustainabletourism

Situated in the foothills of Cambodia’s most sacred mountain, the new Phum Borann Homestay provides an excellent base for exploring some of the kingdom’s lesser-known cultural treasures. Guests can trek to temples and villages to learn about rice wine production or cotton weaving. Learn more about this authentic homestay experience at: https://buff.ly/3VGlhRf #AsianTrails #Cambodia #PhnomKulen

Congratulations to Maly Chan, our Assistant to Program and Inbound Manager at Asian Trails Cambodia. This month marks Maly's 10th year at Asian Trails and we are delighted to share her success. Over the years, Maly has made many valuable contributions and has grown to become an integral part of our Inbound team. Thank you Maly, for your hard work and dedication. We look forward to working with you for many more years to come. #AsianTrails #careers #travelprofessionals

Asian Trails' CEO Laurent Kuenzle had the privilege of spending a week in Sumba in June. He spent time exploring the mystical island made famous by the traditional houses with thatched roofs reaching for the sky. There are many outdoor activities throughout Western Sumba, including hiking one of the numerous trails, swimming in lagoons, walking through lush rice fields or exploring one of the many idyllic waterfalls. Sumbanese arts and crafts are also well known. The rough wooden spiritual statues and 𝘐𝘬𝘢𝘵 fabrics are very special indeed and these cultural icons reflect the deep spirit and nature of the people on Sumba. Read more about Laurent's journey or reach out to our Indonesia team to tailor a Sumba island programme at: https://buff.ly/3A7qOcw #AsianTrails #Indonesia #Sumba

Asian Trails has an opportunity for a Spanish-speaking Tour Representative in #Thailand. The successful candidate will be responsible for liaising with our Spanish-speaking guests and ensuring they enjoy a smooth and comfortable stay with us. For more details or to apply, visit https://buff.ly/4c8WCuP #AsianTrails #careers

Meet us at PATA Travel Mart 2024! Travis Clark, our Thailand Inbound Manager for English-Speaking Markets, is looking forward to sharing news and updates about our latest travel innovations. The event will be held at Queen Sirikit National Convention Centre on 27-29 August 2024. See you there at Booth F03. #AsianTrails #Thailand #PATA Pacific Asia Travel Association (PATA)-Thailand Chapter

Indonesian carrier Citilink Airlines announced plans to launch a new charter service between Jakarta, Indonesia and Danang, Vietnam. Set to take off within the third quarter of 2024, the new flights will open up new routes for travellers in South-East Asia. Read more at: https://buff.ly/3LLSZjO #AsianTrails #Indonesia #Vietnam

In this month's 𝘛𝘳𝘢𝘪𝘭𝘣𝘭𝘢𝘻𝘦𝘳, Asian Trails' CEO Laurent Kuenzle shares his recent experience of Sumba, the mystical Indonesian island located south-east of Bali. We also share news from around the region, including our new Digital Trails in Kuala Lumpur, a new lotus farm experience in Cambodia and an engaging community project in Thailand. Read the full issue: https://lnkd.in/g7pRwCdd #AsianTrails #Trailblazer
